iv. A credit in favour of Us or the intermediary is made through an electronic medium including the internet.
    b. In the event that the total premium due is not paid to Us (or the intermediary through whom this Policy or Bond was effected) on or before the inception date or the renewal date, then the insurance shall not attach and no benefits whatsoever shall be payable by Us. Any payment received thereafter shall be of no effect whatsoever as cover has not attached.
    c. **Premium Payment**
        i. The payment of the premium when it is due will ensure the continuance of the Policy in force until the next premium is due;
        ii. This Policy will be renewed upon the payment of the premium when it is due either on a monthly, annual or lump sum basis as applicable and stated in the Policy Schedule unless prior written notice of cancellation has been given in accordance with General Condition 4 or the Policy has otherwise been terminated.
questions: How does the requirement for premium payment through electronic mediums like the internet affect the validity of the insurance cover and what happens if payment is delayed beyond the inception or renewal date?
What are the consequences on policy benefits if the total premium is not paid on or before the inception or renewal date, and how does this interact with any payments made after these dates?
In what ways does the timing of premium payment influence the attachment of insurance cover and the insurer's liability to pay benefits under this policy?
How does the policy ensure continuance of coverage upon timely premium payment, and what are the implications if the premium is paid late or not at all?
What conditions must be met for the policy to be renewed automatically, and how do prior written cancellation notices or policy termination affect this renewal process?
How does the policy handle premium payments made on a monthly, annual, or lump sum basis in relation to policy renewal and coverage continuity?
What is the role of the intermediary in the premium payment process, and how does payment through an intermediary impact the attachment of insurance cover?
If a premium payment is made after the inception or renewal date, what is the policy's stance on coverage attachment and benefit entitlement?
How do the general conditions, specifically General Condition 4, interact with premium payment requirements to affect policy cancellation and renewal?
What documentation or proof of premium payment is implied or required to confirm that the policy remains in force and benefits are payable?
How does the policy address scenarios where partial premium payments are made before the inception or renewal date, and what effect does this have on coverage?
In cases where the policy is renewed upon premium payment, how does the policy treat any premiums paid in advance for future periods?
What are the implications for coverage if the policyholder fails to pay the premium on time but the insurer or intermediary receives the payment electronically after the due date?
How does the policy define the inception date and renewal date in relation to premium payment deadlines and coverage attachment?
What happens to the insurance cover and benefits if the policyholder cancels the policy in writing before the premium due date but the premium is still paid?
How does the policy ensure that no benefits are payable if the premium is unpaid at inception, and what exceptions, if any, exist for late payments?

How does the policy distinguish between premium payments made directly to the insurer versus through an intermediary, and what are the consequences for coverage if payments are delayed in either case?
What are the effects on policy renewal and coverage if the policyholder provides prior written notice of cancellation but also pays the premium on the renewal date?
How does the policy address the scenario where the premium payment is made on time but the insurer or intermediary fails to process it before the inception or renewal date?
What conditions or clauses in the policy govern the relationship between premium payment timing, policy attachment, and the insurer's obligation to pay claims?
